text.0: the bull of men who cherishes all people king of the races indra called of many.
text.1: fameloving praised hither to me with succour turn having yoked both vigorous bay horses.
text.2: thy mighty stallions yoked by prayer o indra thy coursers to thy mighty chariot harnessed.
text.3: ascend thou these and borne by them come hither with soma juice outpoured indra we call thee.
text.4: ascend thy mighty car the mighty soma is poured for thee and sweets are sprinkled round us.
text.5: come down to usward bull of human races come having harnessed them with strong bay horses.
text.6: here is godreaching sacrifice here the victim here indra are the prayers here is the soma.
text.7: strewn is the sacred grass come hither Śakra seat thee and drink unyoke thy two bay coursers.
text.8: come to us indra come thou highly lauded to the devotions of the singer māna.
text.9: singing may we find early through thy succour may we find strengthening food in full abundance.
